revised_title: Inheritance of Acquired Food Habits in Sawflies
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the egg-laying instincts of the sawfly, Pontania salicis, to study the inheritance of acquired food habits. They found that the sawflies consistently laid their eggs on a specific type of willow plant, even when other suitable plants were available. This discovery supports the idea that acquired food habits can be inherited and passed down through generations.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Evolution
